Despite everything, we share what little we have. A cup of tea can mean the world right now.

I dream of peace, but each morning brings another threat.

Electricity is cut off most days. At night, we use candles, but I'm afraid of starting a fire.

Today, the sounds of distant explosions echoed through our neighborhood. My children and I huddled in our small living room, praying that the walls would hold.

Our community organizes food distribution in secret to avoid raids.
